EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Dear {!Contact.FirstName},
Thank you for using LegalZoom.
The description of goods and services for your Trademark application may be inadequate. The US Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) requires a specific list of goods and services for each Trademark. Such descriptions are vital to the USPTO, as they are used to group each Trademark within a specific International Classification. An example of a specific description may include "Apparel, namely hats, t-shirts, sweatshirts" or "a retail store selling [insert goods sold here]".
Please visit {!snippetVariable.tm_gs_manual} to view more of the USPTO's list of acceptable descriptions for goods and services. To use this tool, enter specific keywords (i.e. "clothing") and a listing of descriptions will appear with the appropriate class numbers. You can adopt any of the descriptions displayed that are appropriate.
**Please note that if you have paid for one class, each additional class will require a $385 fee.**
Because LegalZoom is prohibited by law from giving legal advice, it is our customers' responsibility to develop a goods and services description that is appropriate for their Trademark. Although inadequate goods and services descriptions are often able to be amended after a Trademark application has been filed, the scope of the description cannot be broadened. Such amendments may also delay the registration process. ***LegalZoom will not file Trademark amendments on behalf of customers.***
For more information relating to goods and services, as well as International Classifications, visit {!snippetVariable.tm_resources_guides}
Feel free to contact our {!snippetVariable.cc_dept_full} if we can be of further assistance. Simply reply to this email, or call us toll free at {!snippetVariable.ccphone}. Our {!snippetVariable.cc_dept_full} business hours are {!snippetVariable.cchours}.
Thank you again for choosing LegalZoom.
Best regards,
LegalZoom {!snippetVariable.ipdtm_dept_full} {!snippetVariable.ccphone} | {!snippetVariable.lz_address} {!snippetVariable.lz_website}
